articles.author: McKenna Oxenden
articles.title: Potentially Deadly Bacteria Detected in U.S. Soil for First Time - The New York Times
articles.description: The bacteria, Burkholderia pseudomallei, was found along the Gulf Coast region of Southern Mississippi. Previously, it had been detected in parts of Asia and Australia.
articles.content: Most melioidosis cases occur outside of the United States, the C.D.C. said. But last year, four people in four different states were infected with melioidosis after using contaminated aromatherapy sp… [+992 chars]

articles.title: U.S. Develops 3D-Prints Satellite Sensors – OpenGov Asia - OpenGov Asia
articles.description: Researchers in the United States have developed a digitally generated plasma sensor that is both inexpensive and quick to build, with the goal of assisting scientists in weather forecasting and climate change research.

articles.title: Richie Koh: Singapore showbiz's new golden boy? The young actor's performance is making waves - Channel NewsAsia
articles.description: In the currently-airing drama Your World In Mine, Koh’s unaffected portrayal of a 21-year-old with the intellectual age of a seven-year-old has garnered lots of praise, including from lauded veterans like Chen Hanwei. What’s the actor himself really like? CNA…

articles.title: Former 76ers Player Signing With New Team - Sports Illustrated
articles.description: Former Seton Hall star Myles Powell is signing with the Bay Area Dragons in the East Asia Super League. Powell has played for the Philadelphia 76ers, and also been with the New York Knicks organization.
articles.content:
